page.title: 10Occupations
page.content: Approximately 25% of the employed population work in the village of Woodcote. The majority are employed at the state schools, the boy's residential public school and in the playgroups. Others work in local industry or local shops. Approximately 35% of the working population travel to Reading daily, many of whom are employed in the rapidly developing computer industry based there. Approximately 15% comute to London and are involved in banking,insurance and large companies. The majority of the remaining 25% work in nearby towns such as Oxford, Wallingford, Newbury and Henley on Thames. About 2% of the working population is employed on farms in the area. There is little unemployment at the moment.
